qas.question: After her second solo album, what other entertainment venture did Beyonce explore?
To set the record for Grammys, how many did Beyonce win?
For what movie did Beyonce receive  her first Golden Globe nomination?
When did Beyonce take a hiatus in her career and take control of her management?
Which album was darker in tone from her previous work?
After what movie portraying Etta James, did Beyonce create Sasha Fierce?
When did Destiny's Child end their group act?
What was the name of Beyoncé's second solo album?
What was Beyoncé's first acting job, in 2006?
What is the name of Beyoncé's alter-ego?

context: Following the disbandment of Destiny's Child in <a7_0>June 2005<a7_0/>, she released her second solo album, <a8_0>B'Day<a8_0/> (2006), which contained hits "Déjà Vu", "Irreplaceable", and "Beautiful Liar". <a5_0>Beyoncé<a5_0/> also ventured into <a0_0>acting<a0_0/>, with a Golden Globe-nominated performance in <a3_0><a9_0>Dreamgirls<a9_0/><a3_0/> (2006), and starring roles in The Pink Panther (2006) and Obsessed (2009). Her marriage to rapper <a1_0><a10_0>Jay Z<a10_0/><a1_0/> and portrayal of Etta James in <a6_0>Cadillac Records<a6_0/> (2008) influenced her third album, I Am... <a11_0>Sasha Fierce<a11_0/> (2008), which saw the birth of her alter-ego Sasha Fierce and earned a record-setting <a2_0>six<a2_0/> Grammy Awards in <a4_0>2010<a4_0/>, including Song of the Year for "Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It)". Beyoncé took a hiatus from music in 2010 and took over management of her career; her fourth album 4 (2011) was subsequently mellower in tone, exploring 1970s funk, 1980s pop, and 1990s soul. Her critically acclaimed fifth studio album, Beyoncé (2013), was distinguished from previous releases by its experimental production and exploration of darker themes.
